6810/A0/06/880/004.status_value: The CO redefined its communication and advocacy priorities and strategy in 2016 with support from the RO responding to the particular threat the El Nino crisis and the Yellow Fever outbreak posed to children and their families. In 2017 the strategy will be adopted based on 2016 Annual Review recommendations and in sight of the upcoming MTR.

6810/A0/05/800/002.status_value: Done on regular basis by Finance Unit for reclassification of expenditure.

Close coordination of senior management in the stewardship of the Office.  Timely decisions to ensure timely action and mitigation of risks.

6810/A0/05/918/023.status_value: A manual on implementing the CFM initiative was developed in collaboration with the National Council for Children  which includes a certification system tool. Approval for implementation is pending at Ministry level.
6810/A0/05/918/023.indicator_name: A Certification system of Child Friendly Municipalities is established at national level and effectively implemented in at least 2 municipalities  using SICA as a monitoring and evaluation tool for certification

6810/A0/05/919/009.status_value: Human interest stories prepared on key 11 Commitments for children and disseminated on UNICEF/Angola webpage  facebook  donor reports and toolkits. Annual Report and 2012 calendar prepared based on the 11 Commitments for Angolan Children.
6810/A0/05/919/009.indicator_name: # of key issues and interventions for Angola's most vulnerable children documented and disseminated for strategic advocacy and fundraising

6810/A0/05/912/040.status_value: Plans have been approved by the Commission of Directors in both Ministries. The plan for a national strategy to prevent HIV/AIDS  Malaria and Tuberculosis (2013-2017) was approved by Commission of Ministers. Aspects of both plans are well reflected in the National Plan for Development (2013-2017) of the Government.
6810/A0/05/912/040.indicator_name: A national strategy for the prevention of HIV in children and youth  especially the most vulnerable and those that frequently engage in risky behaviors is developed and approved by government.

6810/A0/05/912/040.status_value: Final draft manual and guide for peer education on HIV/AIDS and other transmittable diseases produced. ToRs for quick assessment of knowledge of teachers on life skills (e.g. prevention of HIV/AIDS) are proposed to stakeholders.
6810/A0/05/912/040.indicator_name: % of young people aged 15-24 years with comprehensive knowledge of HIV transmission and prevention.

Public advocacy strategy not yet finalized
6810/A0/06/887/003.indicator_name: Percentage of stakeholders  opinion makers and partners aware of key child rights issues

6810/A0/06/887/002.status_value: Following a rapid assessment  UNICEF Angola implemented integrated interventions in Health  Nutrition  Education and WASH. 537 health workers and 418 community workers were trained through 310 Community Management of Acute Malnutrition (CMAM) centres. With their support  59 188 children were screened using mid-upper arm circumference measuring tapes  and 15 483 and 2 279 children admitted to outpatient and inpatient treatment centres respectively. 17 762 children (6 to 59 months) with Severe Acu
6810/A0/06/887/002.indicator_name: # of health workers trained to strengthen capacities in CMAM in risk provinces identified
6810/A0/06/887/002.headline: UNICEF provided support for the Government as part of the DRC refugee influx crisis by providing key protective behaviors messages to all population of the two reception centres in Luanda Norte. At least 84% of them know how to use correctly the WASH facilities and had good hygiene practices.

6810/A0/06/887/002.status_value: Community Led Total Sanitation (CLTS) interventions reached 56 456 people and 30 240 children  enabling them to build  maintain  and use appropriately designed toilets. With support from community leaders and ADECOs  108 790 people were reached with hygiene and sanitation messages. More than 6.9 million people were reached with communication materials  messages and dialogue on preventing  identifying and treating yellow fever through UNICEF Angola led social mobilization and community awareness
6810/A0/06/887/002.indicator_name: # of community mobilizers reached by IPC trainings to strengthen capacities in keys messages  in response to emergency in risk provinces identified
6810/A0/06/887/002.headline: UNICEF provided support for the Government as part of the DRC refugee influx crisis by providing key protective behaviors messages to all population of the two reception centres in Luanda Norte. At least 84% of them know how to use correctly the WASH facilities and had good hygiene practices.

6810/A0/06/887/002.status_value: In 2016 UNICEF Angola supported the birth registration of 570 499 children aged 0 to 14 years nationwide. In addition  25 UNICEF supported mobile teams registered 104 000 children aged 0-18 years. . A complementary strategy was developed with the Ministry of Health to technically equip and open 38 birth registration offices in health facilities. 38 traditional birth attendants from 7 targeted provinces were trained on required documentation and legal framework for birth registration.
6810/A0/06/887/002.indicator_name: # of traditional birth attendends trained on Birth Registration promotion

At least 84% of them know how to use correctly the WASH facilities and had good hygiene practices.

6810/A0/05/911/036.status_value: As part of WinS WASH supported a baseline survey on access to safe water and sanitation in schools of five provinces. The results will be used to improve targeting the most in need.
6810/A0/05/911/036.indicator_name: nb Key experiences and results documented using evidence provided through effective monitoring and evaluation tools

6810/A0/05/911/035.status_value: All health areas (100%) in ACSD municipalities are reported to be providing the essential package

355 health units providing PMTCT services in 2012.

6810/A0/05/911/034.status_value: Ministry of health Administration data at the end of September 2013: 637058 children under one year old received the third dose Pentavalent vaccine . A national vaccination coverage survey is ongoing.

6810/A0/05/911/034.status_value: Ministry of health Administration data at the end of September 2013: 741 869 children under one year old were vaccinated with Measles vaccine. A national vaccination coverage survey is ongoing.
6810/A0/05/911/034.indicator_name: % of children aged 12-23 months fully vaccinated against Measles

6810/A0/05/911/034.status_value: No wild polio case since July 2011 National Epidemiological data.
6810/A0/05/911/034.indicator_name: The transmission of wild polio virus is interrupted

6810/A0/05/911/033.status_value: 5 223 753 children under five years old received vitamin A during a national campaign conducted in 2013. No survey was conducted to provide coverage in percentage.
6810/A0/05/911/033.indicator_name: % of children <5 who received vitamin A in the last 6 months

6810/A0/05/911/033.status_value: 280 000 pregnant women and children under five years old each received  a long lasting insecticide treated net in targeted 16 municipal areas. No population survey was conducted to provide number of families that have at least one LLIN.

6810/A0/05/911/032.status_value: National Environmental Sanitation Policy developed and submitted to the government for approval  WASH Sector M&E system (SISAS) developed for use by all sector stakeholders. Option B+ (with support from PLHIV) expanded to three provinces.
6810/A0/05/911/032.indicator_name: Adequate policies strategies and plans for health/nutrition  WASH and HIV/AIDS that are available and implemented with particular focus on the most vulnerable and marginalized children and families.

6810/A0/05/920/003.status_value: Main conclusions of the mapping study and the analysis of the Children's Act shows that the child protection system remains weak  under-resourced  and largely marked by isolated and discrete interventions at the grassroots level  while displaying low-levels of coordination and very limited space for civil society participation. In such context  poor programming and service delivery  as well as case management and referral mechanisms  remain major barriers for ensuring the effective protection of
6810/A0/05/920/003.indicator_name: Areas requiring strengthening in national child protection system have been identified through mapping
